Yes, there are several famous religious monuments and buildings in the Pamir Mountains that hold significant religious and cultural importance to the Ismaili Muslim community.

One of them is the Khorog Jamatkhana, which is a mosque located in the town of Khorog in the Tajik Pamirs. The mosque was built in the early 20th century and underwent several restoration projects by the Aga Khan Foundation in the late 1990s. The mosque has a stunningly beautiful interior, with intricate carvings and traditional design elements that reflect the cultural heritage of the Pamiri Ismailis.

Another important religious monument in the Pamir Mountains is the Ostoni Quduq pilgrimage complex, which is located in the Wakhan Valley of the Afghan Pamir Mountains. It is a sacred site that is visited by thousands of Ismaili Muslims every year. The complex includes several buildings, including mosques, guesthouses, and a series of pools thought to have healing properties.

Apart from these, other religious monuments and building in the Pamir Mountains include the Mubarak-i-Wakhani Shrine, the Ismaili Mosque in Murghab, and the Pamir Eco-Cultural Center. Each of these distinctive places reflects the cultural heritage of the Pamiri Ismailis and holds significant religious and cultural importance to the community.
